hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation Cluster Support Bounce
hypothesis_content.statement: When a catalyst triggers clustered liquidations (e.g., $600M+ in 24h) pushing price through a key technical level (e.g., 20-day MA, prior support), the exhaustion of these forced sales creates a temporary support zone. A bounce of 2-4% occurs within the next 12 hours as liquidity replenishes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Large liquidation events create forced selling pressure that is non-discretionary. Once these positions are cleared, the selling pressure abates rapidly. Market makers and opportunistic buyers step in at these technical breakdowns knowing the most vulnerable positions have been flushed.
entry_conditions: 24h total crypto liquidations exceed $600M with longs >70% of total
Price breaks below 20-day moving average on high volume
Price forms a 1-hour bullish divergence (price makes lower low, RSI makes higher low)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 75% of the distance from breakdown point to swing low
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new low below the liquidation-induced swing low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues trending down beyond the liquidation swing low without meaningful bounce (>1%) in >50% of cases, indicating the catalyst revealed deeper fundamental issues.
